docs.snippet: The awarding of nineteen fellowships to scholars and artists in Latin America and the Philippine Islands was announced yesterday by the John Simon Guggenheim Memorial Foundation. The grants total $70,000 and are for studies in science, education and...
docs.lead_paragraph: The awarding of nineteen fellowships to scholars and artists in Latin America and the Philippine Islands was announced yesterday by the John Simon Guggenheim Memorial Foundation. The grants total $70,000 and are for studies in science, education and art.
docs.abstract: 19 in Latin Amer and PI win grants

headline.main: GUGGENHEIM FUND MAKES 19 GRANTS; $70,000 to Go to Scholars and Artists in Latin America and the Philippines

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Sept. 5 (AP) -Argentina and Brazil announced last night they had settled a dispute over a coffee deal that caused strained relations between the two countries three months ago.

docs.snippet: LIMA, Peru, Sept. 6 -- Many incidents that have little importance in themselves combine to give the impression that President Juan Peron of Argentina has intensified his efforts to spread his political philosophy and to draw other South American...
docs.lead_paragraph: LIMA, Peru, Sept. 6 -- Many incidents that have little importance in themselves combine to give the impression that President Juan Peron of Argentina has intensified his efforts to spread his political philosophy and to draw other South American countries into an anti-Yankee bloc.
docs.abstract: comment on indications Peron pushes anti-US bloc formation; country-by-country situation revd; Brazil, Peru and Uruguay stand aloof

headline.main: PERON IS PRESSING FOR ANTI-U.S. BLOC; Bolivian Leader Latest to Get Bid From Argentina -- Only 3 Nations Stand Aloof

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Sept. 8 (UP) -- The Federal Government Council moved today to prevent thousands of Uruguayan boxing fans from crossing the river Plate into Argentina to see their countryman, Dagomar Martinez, fight Archie Moore of St. Louis,...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Sept. 8 (UP) -- The Federal Government Council moved today to prevent thousands of Uruguayan boxing fans from crossing the river Plate into Argentina to see their countryman, Dagomar Martinez, fight Archie Moore of St. Louis, world light heavyweight champion, in Buenos Aires Saturday.
docs.abstract: Uruguay seeks to bar fans from A Moore-D Martinez bout, Buenos Aires

headline.main: Uruguay Would Bar Trip To Argentina to See Bout
